publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2163# Mrs Nanette Milne: BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen—That the Parliament congratulates the north east artist, Stephen Shankland, on winning first prize in the BP Portrait Award 2004; recognises that the BP Portrait Award is one of the most prestigious competitions of its type, and notes that 50 of the portraits entered into the competition, including the winners, can be seen at Aberdeen Art Gallery until 23 January 2005. Supported by: Alex Johnstone*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr David Davidson*
S2M-2163# BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen (lodged on 14 December 2004) Brian Adam*, Murdo Fraser*, Richard Lochhead*, Bill Aitken*
S2M-2163# BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen (lodged on 14 December 2004) Mr Brian Monteith*

S2M-2163# Mrs Nanette Milne: BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen—That the Parliament congratulates the north east artist, Stephen Shankland, on winning first prize in the BP Portrait Award 2004; recognises that the BP Portrait Award is one of the most prestigious competitions of its type, and notes that 50 of the portraits entered into the competition, including the winners, can be seen at Aberdeen Art Gallery until 23 January 2005. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Eleanor Scott, Mr David Davidson, Brian Adam, Murdo Fraser, Richard Lochhead, Bill Aitken, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2163# BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen (lodged on 14 December 2004) Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S2M-2163# BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen (lodged on 14 December 2004) John Scott*
S2M-2163# BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen (lodged on 14 December 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2163# BP Portrait Award in Aberdeen (lodged on 14 December 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
